body_html:
so when you have your own c++ project ,
i recommend you to compile tensor first,
and then copy the entire tensorflow folder to your c++ project,
in your c++ project , config -I -L -l paths to point to the tensorflow folder.

compile errors always caused by -I -L path not found and easy to solve
if there are runtime errors , modify tensorflow/contrib/makefile/gen/Makefile to add sources to libtensorflow.a, then re-run your c++ project after the new libtensorflow.a is built.
body_text:
so when you have your own c++ project ,
i recommend you to compile tensor first,
and then copy the entire tensorflow folder to your c++ project,
in your c++ project , config -I    -L    -l  paths to point to the tensorflow folder.
compile errors always caused by -I -L path not found and easy to solve
if there are runtime errors , modify  tensorflow/contrib/makefile/gen/Makefile to add sources to libtensorflow.a, then re-run your c++ project after  the new libtensorflow.a is built.
body:
so when you have your own c++ project , 
i recommend you to compile tensor first, 
and then copy the entire tensorflow folder to your c++ project, 
in your c++ project , config -I    -L    -l  paths to point to the tensorflow folder.

compile errors always caused by -I -L path not found and easy to solve
if there are runtime errors , modify  tensorflow/contrib/makefile/gen/Makefile to add sources to libtensorflow.a, then re-run your c++ project after  the new libtensorflow.a is built.
